author: andy
post: Would you expect de Wesellow to accept the Scriptures as a Christian would? I don’t find this unbelievable. I believe de Wesellow’s case would be more believable if he would not discard information that contradicts his theories. That’s difficult to do because then one has to change the theory in light on reality. The Scriptures are proven reliable, first hand accounts so to discard it to put forth a theory is quite dishonest. No offense to de Wesellow or anyone else is intended..
title: Image on the Outside of the Shroud?

author: andy
post: The first line should read VP8, not VP9 (a video codec). Pete Schumacher was the Production Engineer for the VP8 Image Analyzer. He most certainly did not invent it. The following paragraph contains links to more VP8 specific information. See http://shroudnm.com/docs/SEAM VP8 Presentation.pdf for specific information about the VP8 that I created with Pete’s direction and correction. See also Pete’s paper Photogrammetric Responses From The Shroud of Turin for some more information http://shroudnm.com/docs/1999 05 Photogrammetric Responses from the Shroud of Turin.pdf. You can also visit http://shroudnm.com/welcome.html and select either the audio only or video of Pete speaking about the VP8/Shroud..
title: NASA had nothing to do with it.

author: andy
post: If Rogers is incorrect about an impurity layer, the problem of the affect of radiation on linen means this method of creating the image is impossible based on his chemical examination of the Shroud fibers which did not sustain the damage this expert would expect. Hence it really doesn’t matter if there was an impurity layer or not in terms of radiation. It is impossible for radiation to have caused the image, period..
title: Rogers’ Impurity Layer and Di Lazzaro’s Experiments
